commands.name: data bulk results
commands.description: Get the results of a bulk ingest job that you previously ran.

requiredFlags.name: --job-id
requiredFlags.description: Job ID of the bulk job.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

commands.name: data create file
commands.description: Upload a local file to an org.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --file
requiredFlags.description: Path of file to upload.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --title
optionalFlags.description: New title given to the file (ContentDocument) after it's uploaded.

optionalFlags.name: --parent-id
optionalFlags.description: ID of the record to attach the file to.

commands.name: data create record
commands.description: Create and insert a record into a Salesforce or Tooling API object.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --sobject
requiredFlags.description: API name of the Salesforce or Tooling API object that you're inserting a record into.

requiredFlags.name: --values
requiredFlags.description: Values for the flags in the form <fieldName>=<value>, separate multiple pairs with spaces. When specifying fields, use the format <fieldName>=<value>. Enclose all field-value pairs in one set of double quotation marks, delimited by spaces. Enclose values that contain spaces in single quotes.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --use-tooling-api
optionalFlags.description: Use Tooling API so you can insert a record in a Tooling API object.

commands.name: data delete bulk
commands.description: Bulk delete records from an org using a CSV file. Uses Bulk API 2.0.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --file
requiredFlags.description: CSV file that contains the IDs of the records to update or delete. The CSV file must have only one column ("Id") and then the list of record IDs you want to delete, one ID per line.

requiredFlags.name: --sobject
requiredFlags.description: API name of the Salesforce object, either standard or custom, that you want to update or delete records from.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --wait
optionalFlags.description: Number of minutes to wait for the command to complete before displaying the results. When you execute this command, it starts a job, displays the ID, and then immediately returns control of the terminal to you by default. If you prefer to wait, set the --wait flag to the number of minutes; if it times out, the command outputs the IDs. Use the job ID to check the status of the job with the "sf data delete resume" command.

optionalFlags.name: --async
optionalFlags.description: The parameter --async has been deprecated and will be removed in vNaN.0 or later. Use instead. Run the command asynchronously.

optionalFlags.name: --line-ending
optionalFlags.description: Line ending used in the CSV file. Default value on Windows is `CRLF`; on macOS and Linux it's `LF`.

optionalFlags.name: --hard-delete
optionalFlags.description: Mark the records as immediately eligible for deletion by your org. If you don't specify this flag, the deleted records go into the Recycle Bin. You must have the "Bulk API Hard Delete" system permission to use this flag. The permission is disabled by default and can be enabled only by a system administrator.

commands.name: data delete record
commands.description: Deletes a single record from a Salesforce or Tooling API object.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --sobject
requiredFlags.description: API name of the Salesforce or Tooling API object that you're deleting a record from.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --record-id
optionalFlags.description: ID of the record you're deleting.

optionalFlags.name: --where
optionalFlags.description: List of <fieldName>=<value> pairs that identify the record you want to delete. When specifying field-value pairs, use the format <fieldName>=<value>. Enclose all field-value pairs in one set of double quotation marks, delimited by spaces. Enclose values that contain spaces in single quotes.

optionalFlags.name: --use-tooling-api
optionalFlags.description: Use Tooling API so you can delete a record from a Tooling API object.

commands.name: data delete resume
commands.description: Resume a bulk delete job that you previously started. Uses Bulk API 2.0.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --target-org
optionalFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the "target-org" configuration variable is already set.

optionalFlags.name: --job-id
optionalFlags.description: ID of the job you want to resume.

optionalFlags.name: --use-most-recent
optionalFlags.description: Use the ID of the most recently-run bulk job.

optionalFlags.name: --wait
optionalFlags.description: Number of minutes to wait for the command to complete before displaying the results.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

commands.name: data export bulk
commands.description: Bulk export records from an org into a file using a SOQL query. Uses Bulk API 2.0.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --output-file
requiredFlags.description: File where records are written.

requiredFlags.name: --result-format
requiredFlags.description: Format to write the results.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --wait
optionalFlags.description: Time to wait for the command to finish, in minutes.

optionalFlags.name: --async
optionalFlags.description: The parameter --async has been deprecated and will be removed in vNaN.0 or later. Use instead. Don't wait for the job to complete.

optionalFlags.name: --query
optionalFlags.description: SOQL query to execute.

optionalFlags.name: --query-file
optionalFlags.description: File that contains the SOQL query.

optionalFlags.name: --all-rows
optionalFlags.description: Include records that have been soft-deleted due to a merge or delete. By default, deleted records are not returned.

optionalFlags.name: --column-delimiter
optionalFlags.description: Column delimiter to be used when writing CSV output. Default is COMMA.

optionalFlags.name: --line-ending
optionalFlags.description: Line ending to be used when writing CSV output. Default value on Windows is is `CRLF`; on macOS and Linux it's `LR`.

commands.name: data export resume
commands.description: Resume a bulk export job that you previously started. Uses Bulk API 2.0.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --job-id
optionalFlags.description: Job ID of the bulk export.

optionalFlags.name: --use-most-recent
optionalFlags.description: Use the job ID of the bulk export job that was most recently run.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

requiredFlags.name: --query
requiredFlags.description: SOQL query, or filepath of a file that contains the query, to retrieve records.

optionalFlags.name: --json

optionalFlags.name: --api-version

optionalFlags.name: --plan
optionalFlags.description: Generate multiple sObject tree files and a plan definition file for aggregated import.

optionalFlags.name: --prefix
optionalFlags.description: Prefix of generated files.

optionalFlags.name: --output-dir
optionalFlags.description: Directory in which to generate the JSON files; default is current directory.

Enclose all field-value pairs in one set of double quotation marks, delimited by spaces. Enclose values that contain spaces in single quotes.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version

optionalFlags.name: --wait

commands.name: data import tree
commands.description: Import data from one or more JSON files into an org.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --files
optionalFlags.description: Comma-separated and in-order JSON files that contain the records, in sObject tree format, that you want to insert.

optionalFlags.name: --plan
optionalFlags.description: Plan definition file to insert multiple data files. Unlike when you use the `--files` flag, the files listed in the plan definition file **can** contain more then 200 records. When the CLI executes the import, it automatically batches the records to comply with the 200 record limit set by the API. The order in which you list the files in the plan definition file matters. Specifically, records with lookups to records in another file should be listed AFTER that file. For example, let's say you're loading Account and Contact records, and the contacts have references to those accounts. Be sure you list the Accounts file before the Contacts file. The plan definition file has the following schema: - items(object) - SObject Type: Definition of records to be insert per SObject Type - sobject(string) - Name of SObject: Child file references must have SObject roots of this type - files(array) - Files: An array of files paths to load

commands.name: data query
commands.description: Execute a SOQL query.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --query
optionalFlags.description: SOQL query to execute.

optionalFlags.name: --file
optionalFlags.description: File that contains the SOQL query.

optionalFlags.name: --use-tooling-api
optionalFlags.description: Use Tooling API so you can run queries on Tooling API objects.

optionalFlags.name: --all-rows
optionalFlags.description: Include deleted records. By default, deleted records are not returned.

optionalFlags.name: --result-format
optionalFlags.description: Format to display the results; the --json flag overrides this flag.

optionalFlags.name: --output-file
optionalFlags.description: File where records are written; only CSV and JSON output formats are supported.

commands.name: data resume
commands.description: View the status of a bulk data load job or batch.

requiredFlags.name: --target-org
requiredFlags.description: Username or alias of the target org. Not required if the `target-org` configuration variable is already set.

requiredFlags.name: --job-id
requiredFlags.description: ID of the job whose status you want to view.

optionalFlags.name: --json
optionalFlags.description: Format output as json.

optionalFlags.name: --flags-dir
optionalFlags.description: Import flag values from a directory.

optionalFlags.name: --api-version
optionalFlags.description: Override the api version used for api requests made by this command

optionalFlags.name: --batch-id
optionalFlags.description: ID of the batch whose status you want to view; you must also specify the job ID.

optionalFlags.name: --result-format

commands.name: data update record

optionalFlags.name: --where
optionalFlags.description: List of <fieldName>=<value> pairs that identify the record you want to update. When using field-value pairs for both identifying the record and specifiyng the new field values, use the format <fieldName>=<value>. Enclose all field-value pairs in one set of double quotation marks, delimited by spaces. Enclose values that contain spaces in single quotes.

optionalFlags.description: Use Tooling API so you can update a record in a Tooling API object.
